SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

de.systemagmbh.tools.language
Class CSysETXStore

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.tools.language.CSysETXStore
public class CSysETXStore
extends Object

This class enables language specific messages for applications. It is intended mainly for outputting error messages but can be used for any other message too, if provieded in an appropriate ResourceBundle.

Examples:

Some examples show the usage of the different methods.

Simple example:

Your resource bundle contains the following definition for error code '99': 
   99 = Unrecoverable error. Resistance is futile!
Output the message for error code '99' with the default Locale (en_US): 
   System.err.println(CSysETXStore.getETX(99));
The output will be: 
 Unrecoverable error. Resistance is futile!

Message with arguments:

Output the message for error code '1' in different languages. Your resource bundle defines for english the following message: 
   1 = Application {1} runs for {0,number,integer} hours now.
For german it contains this definition: 
   1 = Das Programm {1} läuft nun schon seit {0,number,integer} Stunden.
Your code to output this message in english and german may look like this: 
   CSysETXStore etc = new CSysETXStore();
   Object[] messageArguments = {
     new Integer(7),
     "TestI18n"
   };

   System.err.println(etc.getETX(1,messageArgs));
   etc.setLocale("deutsch");
   System.err.println(etc.getETX(1,messageArgs));
Output: 
   Application TestI18n runs for 7 hours now.
   Das Programm TestI18n läuft nun schon seit 7 Stunden.

Complex message with arguments and a ChoiceFormat:

English definition in resource bundle: 
   3 = {1} read from server {0} (This is equivalent to {2,number,#00.##} kBytes.).
   3_noMsg = No messages
   3_oneMsg = One message
   3_someMsg = Some messages
   3_multipleMsg = A huge number of messages
German definition in resource bundle: 
   3 = Vom Server {0} {1} gelesen (Dies entspricht {2,number,#.##} kBytes.).
   3_noMsg = wurden keine Nachrichten
   3_oneMsg = wurde eine Nachricht
   3_someMsg = wurden einige Nachrichten
   3_multipleMsg = wurden viele Nachrichten
Program code: 
   CSysETXStore etc = new CSysETXStore();
   double[] msgLimits = {0,1,2,10};
   String[] msgStrings = {
     etc.getETX("3_noMsg"),
     etc.getETX("3_oneMsg"),
     etc.getETX("3_someMsg"),
     etc.getETX("3_multipleMsg")
   };

   ChoiceFormat choiceForm = new ChoiceFormat(msgLimits, msgStrings);
Apply the choiceForm to the second message argument in ma. 
   Format[] formats2 = {null, choiceForm, null};
   Object[] ma2 = new Object[] {
     "Dandelion", 
     new Integer(0), 
     new Double(0.0)
   };
Run the following code for every language to see the difference. 
   System.out.println("=> " + etc.getETX("3", ma2, formats2));
Output: 
   => No messages read from server Dandelion (This is equivalent to 00 kBytes.).
   => Vom Server Dandelion wurden keine Nachrichten gelesen (Dies entspricht 0 kBytes.).
Change the values in the message arguments and run again. 
 ma2[1] = new Integer(1);
 ma2[2] = new Double(0.125);
 System.out.println("=> " + etc.getETX("3", ma2, formats2));
Output: 
   => One message read from server Dandelion (This is equivalent to 00.12 kBytes.).
   => Vom Server Dandelion wurde eine Nachricht gelesen (Dies entspricht 0,12 kBytes.).
You can see the effect of the different number format patterns when formatting the kBytes value. 
 ma2[1] = new Integer(2);
 ma2[2] = new Double(0.125 * 2);
 System.out.println("=> " + etc.getETX("3", ma2, formats2));
Output: 
   => Some messages read from server Dandelion (This is equivalent to 00.25 kBytes.).
   => Vom Server Dandelion wurden einige Nachrichten gelesen (Dies entspricht 0,25 kBytes.).
Nine messages are still 'some'. 
 ma2[1] = new Integer(9);
 ma2[2] = new Double(0.125 * 9);
 System.out.println("=> " + etc.getETX("3", ma2, formats2));
Output: 
   => Some messages read from server Dandelion (This is equivalent to 01.12 kBytes.).
   => Vom Server Dandelion wurden einige Nachrichten gelesen (Dies entspricht 1,12 kBytes.).
Eleven messages are 'a huge number'. 
 ma2[1] = new Integer(11);
 ma2[2] = new Double(0.125 * 11);
 System.out.println("=> " + etc.getETX("3", ma2, formats2));
Output: 
   => A huge number of messages read from server Dandelion (This is equivalent to 01.38 kBytes.).
   => Vom Server Dandelion wurden viele Nachrichten gelesen (Dies entspricht 1,38 kBytes.).

Using with exceptions:

On the 'throw side' you provide all necessary informations like
  • The error code.
  • The message argumens.
  • The ChoiceFormats if necessary.
The exception must have an appropriate constructor to set all necessary informations. The exception carries the informations to the 'catch side' where you show the formatted message: 
   System.err.println(etc.getETX(theException));

Be careful!

The single quotation mark (') disables patterns. For pattern 
Hello, my name is '{0}'.
you will get 
Hello, my name is {0}.
instead of 
Hello, my name is 'George'.
If you want to have single quotation marks in your output you have to quote them. So the correct pattern is: 
Hello, my name is ''{0}''.

Version:
$Revision: 1.8 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich, Eugen Obermeier

Method Detail

addResource

public static void addResource(String bundleFile)
Add a new resource to the String Store.

Parameters:
bundleFile - The path to the resource including the file name. (Only the first part. E.g. MyApplicationBundle if the file name is MyApplicationBundle_de.properties.)

getETX

public static String getETX(String s,
                            Locale loc)
Get a message by the given string and locale.
The error text is read from the resource file.
If the resource file cannot be found, the default value is returned.
If no default value is defined (in CSysETXStore), the message 'No error text found' is returned.

Parameters:
s - the key of the message in the resource bundle
loc - The Locale defines the language resp. the file to look for the message or pattern.
Returns:
a message

getETX

public static String getETX(String s,
                            Locale loc,
                            Object[] args)
Formats the selected message (pattern) with the specified arguments.

Parameters:
s - a message
loc - a Locale
args - an object array with all arguments needed by the specified pattern
Returns:
formatted message
See Also:
getETX(String, Locale)

getETX

public static String getETX(String s,
                            Locale loc,
                            Object[] args,
                            Format[] formats)
Formats the selected message (pattern) with the specified arguments. formats may contain one or more ChoiceFormat objects. The formats are applied to their corresponding index in the args object, not to their index in the pattern. See class description for more details.

Note: Quoted braces ('{', '}') in the pattern are not handled correctly! Therefore don't use it!

Parameters:
s - a message
loc - a Locale
args - an object array with all arguments needed by the specified pattern
formats - an array with format objects
Returns:
formatted message
See Also:
for description of the other parameters.

                            Locale loc)
Convenience routine.

Parameters:
ecd - The error code of the error that occured.
loc - a Locale
Returns:
complete error message

getETX

public static String getETX(ASysException sex,
                            Locale loc)
Convenience routine. Get the error message for the given exception. The exception may contain
  • an error code
  • an object array with arguments for the message pattern
  • an format array with formats to apply to the message.

Parameters:
sex - the exception
loc - the locale to use.
Returns:
message for the given exception
See Also:
getETX(String, Locale, Object[], Format[])

getETX

public static String getETX(ASysException sex,
                            String language)
Convenience routine.

Parameters:
sex - an ASysException
language - A string specifying a certain locale.
Returns:
error message for the given exception
See Also:
getETX(ASysException, Locale)

getLocale

public static Locale getLocale()
Returns the current locale.

Returns:
the current Locale.

setLocale

public static void setLocale(Locale locale)
Sets the locale to the specified locale. If the specified locale is 'null' the DEFAULT_LOCALE is used.

Parameters:
locale - a Locale.

setLocale

public static void setLocale(String language)
Sets the locale by the given language. Uses the result of getLocale(String).

Parameters:
language - a language String.

getLocale

public static Locale getLocale(String language)
Tries to create a Locale out of the given language string.

Parameters:
language - The language to be transformed into a locale. Supported languages are 'de', 'deutsch', 'german', 'aleman' for german and 'fr', 'französisch', 'french', 'francais' for french language.
Returns:
the locale for the given language.
If the given language is unknown the DEFAULT_LOCALE is returned.

clearResources

public static void clearResources()
Remove all resources from the ETX-Store. Mainly intended for unit test scenarios.

logError

protected static void logError(String logText,
                               Throwable thr)
Logs error messages via CSysLog.log().

Parameters:
logText - the log text.
thr - the Throwable to log
